transportAdvice: Oslo has an efficient public transit network including metro, tram, bus, and ferry lines that connect the city centre to most tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The compact city centre is very walkable, and taxis are widely available though expensive.

weather.description: Cold, dark winter month with frequent snow and short daylight hours, requiring warm layered clothing.
Still cold and wintry with snow likely, but daylight begins to noticeably increase.
Early spring brings longer days and occasional thaws, though snow and frost remain common.
Spring arrives with milder temperatures and budding greenery, though cool evenings persist.
Pleasant and increasingly warm with long daylight hours and the city coming alive outdoors.
Warm early summer with very long days and lively outdoor culture across the city.
The warmest month of the year with long bright evenings and peak tourist activity.
Still warm and enjoyable with slightly shorter days as summer begins to wind down.
Autumn sets in with cooler temperatures and beautiful foliage across parks and surrounding forests.
Cool and increasingly wet with frequent rain and rapidly shortening days.
Cold and grey with rain or sleet likely and limited daylight, marking the onset of winter.
Dark and cold with snow possible and a festive Christmas atmosphere in the city centre.
